Caption: Figure 1: A semi-immersive display showing the relationship between the model input, the residual (the error between the model and the real system) over time. The visualization reveals that in some regions the residual is quite large, i.e. the model does not ﬁt very well. The temporal information is crucial for the model validation which is an important step in the system identiﬁcation process.

Figure 2: Model validation. The output yt of the system, here dis- crete, is compared to the output of the model, ŷt . The diﬀerence between the two makes the residual, et = ŷt − yt , t = 1, 2, . . . , N. If the residual is dependent on the noise only, not on the input ut , then there is nothing more to model. Depending on the application, ut and et could be either a scalar or a vector.
Figure 3: Our 3D visualization running on a semi-immersive display. The visualization shows the relationship between ut , et and t.
Figure 3: Our 3D visualization running on a semi-immersive display. The visualization shows the relationship between ut , et and t.
